properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 8:20PM EST by NWS Northern Indiana
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a
Flood Warning for the following rivers...

Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties

.Recent basin rainfall of 1 to 2 inches combined with some snow melt
has caused rises on the Wabash river. Minor flooding is now expected
near Linn Grove by early Tuesday night.

The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a

* Flood Warning for the Wabash River near Linn Grove.
* from Tuesday evening until further notice.
* At 8 PM Monday the stage was 10.3 feet and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage Tuesday night  and
crest near 12.8 feet around  1 PM Thursday February 13.
* At 12.0 feet...The flooding of county roads begin.
* This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.4 feet which occurred
on Dec 29 2015.
properties.instruction:
Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep
to allow safe passage. Most vehicle fatalities occur at night in
vehicles. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay
tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and
updated forecasts.

Detailed river forecasts and more information can be found on the
internet at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.

All times are in Eastern Time. This statement will be updated in
about 24 hours or sooner if necessary.
